title: First picture of company director fighting for life after wife and teenage son stabbed to death in home
text:
News First picture of company director fighting for life after wife and teenage son stabbed to death in home Peter Wilkinson, 47, suffered injuries to his chest and back while his wife Tracey and son, 13, were killed in the horrific incident Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Police at scene in Stourbridge after stabbing which killed mother and son Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
This is the first picture of a company director who is fighting for his life after his wife and 13-year-old son were stabbed to death in their home . 
The couple have been named locally as Peter Wilkinson, 47, and his wife Tracey, 50. 
Mr Wilkinson is fighting for his life in hospital with chest and back wounds. 
Mrs Wilkinson and the teenage boy died from their injuries. 
The alleged knifeman fled the scene in Stourbridge, West Midlands, in a stolen Land Rover that crashed several streets away. The first picture of company director Peter Wilkinson, who is fighting for his life in hospital (Photo: Asset VRS) Forensics officers enter the family home after the double killing (Photo: Birmingham Mail) The vehicle was intercepted half an hour after police were called to the home (Photo: Birmingham Mail) 
The three family members were found with stab wounds at their home at 8am today. 
The Land Rover was intercepted by police half an hour later and a man in his 20s was arrested on suspicion of murder and wounding. 
Pictures show the Land Rover severely smashed up after seemingly ploughing into a garden wall. Police are not looking for anyone else in connection with the attack (Photo: Birmingham Mail) The vehicle appears to have crashed into a wall (Photo: Birmingham Mail) 
Mr Wilkinson runs Hill and Smith, a firm that manufactures safety barriers. 
Neighbours said the couple, who also have a daughter who is away at university, were a "nice normal family". 
A resident, who did not want to be named, added: "Peter and Tracey have lived there for about seven or eight years. A forensics tent is set up in the garden (Photo: Birmingham Mail) A dog is removed from the home by police (Photo: PA) 
"They've got a son who is 13 and a daughter who is in her first year at Bristol University. 
"We know them to talk to and say hello to. We would see Peter walking his greyhound along the road and he would always stop to talk. Crime scene investigators prepare to enter the scene (Photo: PA) A forensics officer leaves the property (Photo: Birmingham Mail) 
"They were a nice, normal family. They were lovely. 
"We used to go to the same pub as them up the road and they were very friendly." 
West Midlands Police said in a statement: "A man has been arrested on suspicion of stabbing a woman and her teenage son to death – and seriously injuring her husband – during a knife attack at their Dudley home. A policeman stands guard outside the home (Photo: Birmingham Mail) A police car parked inside the cordon (Photo: Birmingham Mail) 
"Police and ambulance were called to the property in Greyhound Lane, Norton, just after 8am where a man, woman and a boy were found with serious stab wounds. 
"There was nothing that could be done to save the woman, understood to be in her 50s, and she was pronounced dead at the scene. 
"The woman’s 13-year-old son suffered critical stab injuries and was later pronounced dead in hospital. Her husband remains in hospital with stab wounds to his chest and back. Police rushed to the family home at 8am (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Three people were found inside with serious stab wounds (Photo: Birmingham Mail) 
"A Land Rover stolen from outside the home was intercepted by police at around 8.30am in Norton Road and a man in his 20s arrested. 
"He is currently in police custody and will later be questioned on suspicion of murder and wounding." 
Dudley Police Superintendent Lee Kendrick added: “What has unfolded here this morning is horrific and heart-breaking. The road outside remains cordoned off for forensic tests (Photo: Birmingham Mail) 
"Police and ambulance were confronted with an awful scene: a man, woman and boy all with very serious stab injuries. 
“The woman and boy were found in the house and the man in the garden. 
“Tragically there was nothing that could be done to save the woman – and her son later died in hospital from his injuries. 
"Our hearts go out to the victims’ family and friends at this devastating news. A map showing where the suspect was arrested in relation to the location of the family home 
“Clearly our investigation is at a very early stage but we understand the suspect was known to the family and may have been living at the address – although he is not a family relative. 
"We don’t think this was a burglary or a robbery. 
“Our investigation is progressing at pace and we are working to understand exactly what the relationship was between the man and the family. 
"At this stage we are not looking for anyone else in connection with the incident.” 
Anyone with information is asked to call West Midlands Police on 101. Like us on Facebook
